doc:
Vinnette Justine Carroll https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vinnette_Justine_Carroll 0 Vinnette Justine Carroll (March 11, 1922 – November 5, 2002) was an American playwright, actress, and theatre director. She was the first African-American woman to direct on Broadway, with her 1972 production of the musical Don't Bother Me, I Can't Cope. Until Liesl Tommy's 2016 nomination for Eclipsed, Carroll was the only African-American woman to have received a Tony Award nomination for direction. Vinnette_Justine_Carroll ( March_11_,_1922 – November_5_,_2002 ) was an_American_playwright , actress , and theatre_director . She was the_first_African-American_woman to_direct on Broadway , with her_1972_production of the_musical Do_n't_Bother Me , I Ca_n't_Cope . Until Liesl_Tommy 's_2016_nomination for Eclipsed , Carroll was the_only_African-American_woman to_have_received a_Tony_Award_nomination for direction .
